Package com.atakmap.coremap.maps.time

Class CoordinatedTime

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.atakmap.coremap.maps.time.CoordinatedTime
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.os.Parcelable
    public class CoordinatedTime
extends java.lang.Object
implements android.os.Parcelable
    A date-time value as per the Cursor on Target specification. This class ensures proper parsing and string exporting are properly formatted.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  CoordinatedTime.SimpleDateFormatThread
      Allows for a Thread Safe usage of any SimpleDateFormat construct.

    • Field Detail

      • CREATOR

        public static final android.os.Parcelable.Creator<CoordinatedTime> CREATOR

    • Constructor Detail

      • CoordinatedTime

        public CoordinatedTime()
        For creating new timestamps within the system, this method should be used directly.

        Create a CoT time that represents the current time: 1) based on system time measured as the number of milliseconds since Jan. 1, 1970, midnight GMT. 2) or if a GPS delta has been set, the system time corrected to GPS time note: GPS time is not used directly, a correction is used instead, due to the poor granularity of GPS time.

      • CoordinatedTime

        public CoordinatedTime​(long milliseconds)
        Create a CoT time in milliseconds since January 1st 1970 00:00:00 UTC.
        Parameters:
        milliseconds - offset in milliseconds from Unix Epoch

      • CoordinatedTime

        public CoordinatedTime​(android.os.Parcel source)
        Create a CoT time from its Parcel representation
        Parameters:
        source - the parcel with the timestamp

    • Method Detail

      • setCoordinatedTimeMillis

        public static void setCoordinatedTimeMillis​(long gpsTime)
        Set the global offset between the current system time in milliseconds since Jan. 1, 1970, midnight GMT and the GPS time milliseconds since Jan. 1, 1970, midnight GMT. Setting the gps time to 0 indicates no GPS time exists and the coordinated time will be the locally set time.

      • isGPSTime

        public static boolean isGPSTime()
        Indicate if GPS time has been set.

      • getCoordinatedTimeOffset

        public static long getCoordinatedTimeOffset()
        If GPS time has been set, provide the offset from the GPS time and the local device time. If GPS has not been set, the offset will be 0. Note: If GPS time is behind the system time, the number will be negative.

      • millisecondDiff

        public long millisecondDiff​(CoordinatedTime other)

      • addMilliseconds

        public CoordinatedTime addMilliseconds​(int milliseconds)
        Get a CoT time that is a positive or negative number of milliseconds from this Cot time
        Parameters:
        milliseconds - number of milliseconds to add (may be negative)
        Returns:
        the coordinated time with the appropriate number of milliseconds added

      • addSeconds

        public CoordinatedTime addSeconds​(int seconds)
        Get a CoT time that is a positive or negative number of seconds from this Cot time
        Parameters:
        seconds - number of seconds to add (may be negative)
        Returns:
        a new Coordinated time with the appropriate seconds added.

      • getMilliseconds

        public long getMilliseconds()
        Get this CoT time in milliseconds since January 1st 1970 00:00:00 UTC
        Returns:
        the time in milliseconds from EPOCH

      • currentDate

        public static java.util.Date currentDate()
        Obtains the current Java/Android date: 1) based on system time measured as the number of milliseconds since Jan. 1, 1970, midnight GMT. 2) or if a GPS delta has been set, the system time corrected to GPS time note: GPS time is not used directly, a correction is used instead, due to the poor granularity of GPS time.

      • currentTimeMillis

        public static long currentTimeMillis()
        Obtains the current time in millis accurate to GPS time if available, otherwise accurate to the system clock.
        Returns:
        the time in lilliseconds from EPOCH

      • setLoggerDirectory

        public static void setLoggerDirectory​(java.io.File dir)
        Designate for refactoring. Set a reasonable log directory for bad_time, until this is refactored.

      • toCot

        public static java.lang.String toCot​(CoordinatedTime time)
        Produce a valid Cursor on Target formatted date string from a CoordinatedTime object.
        Parameters:
        time - the coordinated time to format for use within a cursor on target message.
        Returns:
        the formatted string.

      • parseNonZeroInt

        @Deprecated
@DeprecatedApi(since="4.10",
               forRemoval=true,
               removeAt="4.13")
public static int parseNonZeroInt​(java.lang.String s)
        Deprecated.
        to be removed without replacement, use Integer.parseInt(String)
        Assuming no sign and standard integers without issues.

      • fromCot

        public static CoordinatedTime fromCot​(java.lang.String date)
                               throws java.text.ParseException
        Parse a CoT time String in the form: 2009-09-15T21:00:00.00Z without using simple date parser. Thread-safe

        Note: This will parse the CoT time string in the format 2009-09-15T21:00:00.00Z and will permissively allow for 2009-09-15T21:00:00.000Z and 2009-09-15T21:00:00.0Z which are not part of the spec.

        Parameters:
        date - A date from a CoT message.
        Returns:
        the coordinated time from derived from the CoT message date.
        Throws:
        java.text.ParseException - if there is not a valid CoT time encountered.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Get the string representation of this CoT time (same as formatTime()).
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
